ref: 1635 uccaṭati ʻ goes away ʼ BhP. 2. *uccaṭyatē ʻ is separated from ʼ. 3. *uccāṭya -- (uccāṭayati ʻ drives away, scares ʼ Pañcat., Pk. uccāḍaï ʻ prevents, is sorry. ʼ) [< *uccr̥tati? Cf. cr̥táti ʻ binds ʼ Dhātup., ávacr̥tati ʻ loosens, lets go ʼ TS.: √cr̥t?]
P. uccaṛnā ʻ (skin) to be separated from the flesh, (a blister) to rise ʼ; -- tr. formation:
P. uceṛnā ʻ to separate skin from the flesh, flay ʼ;
bhal. uċoṛnu ʻ to flay (sheep or goat) ʼ;
bhal. uċoṛnu ʻ to flay (sheep or goat) ʼ;
Ku. uceṛṇo ʻ to skin, peel, take off ʼ;
G. uceṛvũ ʻ to tear off the uppermost covering ʼ; --
